meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to understand or interpret.
meanings.sent1: Her crabbedness in explaining the math problem left the students confused.
meanings.sent2: The crabbedness of the ancient text made it challenging for the scholars to decipher.
meanings.sent3: The crabbedness of the recipe made it seem like a secret code to unlock deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: The crabbedness of the map led the adventurers on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent5: The crabbedness of the professor's handwriting made it look like hieroglyphics.

meanings.definition: The state of being ill-tempered or irritable.
meanings.sent1: His crabbedness in the morning often put a damper on the family's mood.
meanings.sent2: The crabbedness of the customer made the waiter approach with caution.
meanings.sent3: Despite his crabbedness, he couldn't resist smiling at the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The crabbedness of the cat was evident in its arched back and hissing.
meanings.sent5: The crabbedness of the old man softened when he saw the children playing outside.
